pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:0.5.eng: The training rule on legal issues

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarā bhikkhunī thullanandaṃ bhikkhuniṃ upasaṅkamitvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.2.eng: a certain nun went to the nun Thullanandā and said,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.3.eng: “Please come, Venerable, and resolve this legal issue.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.5.pli: “sādhū”ti paṭissuṇitvā, neva vūpasameti na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ karoti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.5.eng: but then neither resolved it nor made any effort to do so.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.6.pli: Atha kho sā bhikkhunī bhikkhunīnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.6.eng: That nun told the nuns what had happened.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.7.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.10.pli: ‘sādhū’ti paṭissuṇitvā, neva vūpasamessati na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ karissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.10.eng: agree to resolve a legal issue, but then neither resolve it nor make any effort to do so?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.11.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā acted like this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.13.pli: ‘sādhū’ti paṭissuṇitvā, neva vūpasameti na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ karotī”ti?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.16.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.16.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā act like this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.18.pli: ‘sādhū’ti paṭissuṇitvā, neva vūpasamessati na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ karissati.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.20.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.20.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.21.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī bhikkhuniyā—‘ehāyye, imaṃ adhikaraṇaṃ vūpasamehī’ti vuccamānā—‘sādhū’ti paṭissuṇitvā sā pacchā anantarāyikinī neva vūpasameyya na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ kareyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:1.21.1.eng: ‘If, when a nun is requested by a nun to resolve a legal issue, she agrees, but then neither resolves it nor makes any effort to resolve it, then, if there were no obstacles, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.8.pli: cattāri adhikaraṇāni— vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.8.eng: there are four kinds of legal issues: legal issues arising from disputes, legal issues arising from accusations, legal issues arising from offenses, legal issues arising from business.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.10.eng: to make a decision on a legal issue.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.11.eng: Then, if there were no obstacles:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.14.eng: she does not resolve it herself.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.15.eng: Nor makes any effort to resolve it:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.16.eng: she does not ask anyone else.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.17.pli: “Neva vūpasamessāmi na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ karissāmī”ti dhuraṃ nikkhittamatte, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.1.17.eng: If, thinking, “I’ll neither resolve it nor make any effort to resolve it,” then, by the mere fact of abandoning her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.1.pli: Upasampannāya upasampannasaññā adhikaraṇaṃ neva vūpasameti na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.1.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she neither resolves the legal issue nor makes any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.2.pli: Upasampannāya vematikā adhikaraṇaṃ neva vūpasameti, na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.2.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she neither resolves the legal issue nor makes any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.3.pli: Upasampannāya anupasampannasaññā adhikaraṇaṃ neva vūpasameti, na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ karoti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.3.eng: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she neither resolves the legal issue nor makes any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.4.pli: Anupasampannāya adhikaraṇaṃ neva vūpasameti, na vūpasamāya ussukkaṃ karoti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.4.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she neither resolves the legal issue nor makes any effort to resolve it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.5.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.6.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.2.7.eng: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.3.3.eng: if she searches, but is unable to find anyone to settle it;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.3.7.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc45:2.3.8.eng: The fifth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:0.5.eng: The training rule on giving food

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī naṭānampi naṭakānampi laṅghakānampi sokajjhāyikānampi kumbhathūṇikānampi sahatthā khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ deti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā was personally giving food to actors, dancers, acrobats, magicians, and musicians, saying,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.4.pli: Naṭāpi naṭakāpi laṅghakāpi sokajjhāyikāpi kumbhathūṇikāpi thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā parisati vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanti—

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.5.pli: “ayyā thullanandā bahussutā bhāṇikā visāradā paṭṭā dhammiṃ kathaṃ kātuṃ;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.5.eng: “Venerable Thullanandā is a learned reciter; she’s confident and skilled at giving teachings.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.6.eng: Give to her; work for her!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.7.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.7.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.8.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā agārikassa sahatthā khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ dassatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.8.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā personally give food to householders?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.9.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī agārikassa sahatthā khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ detī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.9.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.12.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī agārikassa sahatthā khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyaṃ dassati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.12.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.14.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.14.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.15.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī agārikassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:1.15.1.eng: ‘If a nun personally gives fresh or cooked food to a householder or a male wanderer or a female wanderer, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.6.comm: Agāraṁ is typically rendered as “in a house”. The problem with this is that it is not unallowable for a monastic to live in a building that is the equivalent of a house. What a monastic should not do is own a home and then live there.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.8.pli: bhikkhuñca sāmaṇerañca ṭhapetvā yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.8.eng: any male wanderer apart from Buddhist monks and novice monks.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.10.pli: bhikkhuniñca sikkhamānañca sāmaṇeriñca ṭhapetvā yā kāci paribbājikasamāpannā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.10.eng: any female wanderer apart from Buddhist nuns, trainee nuns, and novice nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.12.eng: apart from the five cooked foods

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.13.eng: and water and tooth cleaners, the rest is called “fresh food”.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.13.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “fresh food” for khādanīya, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.15.pli: pañca bhojanāni—odano, kummāso, sattu, maccho, maṃsaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.15.eng: there are five kinds of cooked food: cooked grain, porridge, flour products, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.15.comm: For a discussion of the rendering “flour products” for sattu, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.17.pli: kāyena vā kāyapaṭibaddhena vā nissaggiyena vā deti, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.17.eng: if she gives by body or by what is connected to the body or by releasing, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.1.18.eng: If she gives water or tooth cleaners, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.2.2.eng: if she does not give, but has it given;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.2.3.eng: if she gives by placing it near the person;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.2.4.eng: if she gives ointments for external use;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.2.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc46:2.2.7.eng: The sixth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:0.5.eng: The training rule on communal robes

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī āvasathacīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.2.eng: At that time the nun Thullanandā did not relinquish the communal robe, but continued using it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.3.eng: Other menstruating nuns did not get to use it.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.4.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.4.eng: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.5.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā āvasathacīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.5.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā not relinquish the communal robe, but continue using it?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.6.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī āvasathacīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.6.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.9.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī āvasathacīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.9.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.11.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.11.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.12.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī āvasathacīvaraṃ anissajjitvā paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.12.1.eng: ‘If a nun does not relinquish a communal robe, but continues to use it, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:1.12.1.comm: “A communal robe” renders āvasathacīvara, literally, “a lodging robe”. Since “lodging robe” is awkward in English, and because these robes were used in common among the nuns, I prefer the given rendering.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.1.6.eng: it is given specifically for the use of menstruating nuns.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.1.7.eng: Does not relinquish, but continues to use it:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.1.8.pli: dvetisso rattiyo paribhuñjitvā catutthadivase dhovitvā bhikkhuniyā vā sikkhamānāya vā sāmaṇeriyā vā anissajjitvā paribhuñjati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.1.8.eng: if she uses it for two or three days, washes it on the fourth day, and then uses it again without relinquishing it to a nun or a trainee nun or a novice nun, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.2.1.eng: If it has not been relinquished, and she perceives that it has not, and she uses it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.2.2.eng: If it has not been relinquished, but she is unsure of it, and she uses it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.2.3.eng: If it has not been relinquished, but she perceives that it has, and she uses it, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.2.4.eng: If it has been relinquished, but she perceives that it has not, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.2.5.eng: If it has been relinquished, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.2.6.eng: If it has been relinquished, and she perceives that it has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.3.2.eng: if she relinquishes it and then uses it;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.3.3.eng: if she uses it again at the next turn;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.3.4.eng: if there are no other menstruating nuns;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.3.5.eng: if her robe has been stolen;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.3.6.eng: if her robe has been lost;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.3.9.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc47:2.3.10.eng: The seventh training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandā bhikkhunī āvasathaṃ anissajjitvā cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.2.eng: the nun Thullanandā went wandering without first relinquishing her lodging.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena thullanandāya bhikkhuniyā āvasatho ḍayhati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.3.eng: Soon afterwards her lodging caught fire.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.8.pli: Yaṃ kiñci naṭṭhaṃ sabbaṃ amhe abhiyuñjissatī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.8.eng: She’ll just make us responsible for anything that gets lost.”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.9.pli: Thullanandā bhikkhunī punadeva taṃ āvasathaṃ paccāgantvā bhikkhuniyo pucchi—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.9.eng: When Thullanandā returned to her lodging, she asked the nuns,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.10.eng: “Venerables, I hope you removed my things?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.13.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo āvasathe ḍayhamāne bhaṇḍakaṃ na nīharissantī”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.13.eng: “How could the nuns not remove the contents when a lodging is burning?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.14.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.14.eng: But the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.15.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyā thullanandā āvasathaṃ anissajjitvā cārikaṃ pakkamissatī”ti …pe…
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.15.eng: “How could Venerable Thullanandā go wandering without relinquishing her lodging?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.16.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī āvasathaṃ anissajjitvā cārikaṃ pakkamatī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.16.eng: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.19.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, thullanandā bhikkhunī āvasathaṃ anissajjitvā cārikaṃ pakkamissati.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.19.eng: “How could the nun Thullanandā do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.21.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.21.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.22.1.pli: “Yā pana bhikkhunī āvasathaṃ anissajjitvā cārikaṃ pakkameyya, pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:1.22.1.eng: ‘If a nun goes wandering without relinquishing her lodging, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.1.6.eng: one with a door is what is meant.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.1.8.pli: bhikkhuniyā vā sikkhamānāya vā sāmaṇeriyā vā anissajjitvā parikkhittassa āvasathassa parikkhepaṃ atikkāmentiyā āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.1.8.eng: if she crosses the boundary of an enclosed lodging without first relinquishing it to a nun, a trainee nun, or a novice nun, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.1.8.comm: Presumably this refers to the new lodging she is taking up, not the old lodging she is leaving. That is, she commits the offense when two factors are fulfilled: (1) she has not given up her old lodging; and (2) she has crossed the boundary of a new lodging.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.1.9.pli: Aparikkhittassa āvasathassa upacāraṃ atikkāmentiyā āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.1.9.eng: If she goes beyond the vicinity of an unenclosed lodging, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.2.1.eng: If it has not been relinquished, and she perceives that it has not, and she goes, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.2.2.eng: If it has not been relinquished, but she is unsure of it, and she goes, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.2.3.eng: If it has not been relinquished, but she perceives that it has, and she goes, she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.2.4.eng: If she does not relinquish a lodging without a door, and then goes, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.2.5.eng: If it has been relinquished, but she perceives that it has not, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.2.6.eng: If it has been relinquished, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.2.7.eng: If it has been relinquished, and she perceives that it has, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.3.2.eng: if she relinquishes it and then goes;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.3.4.eng: if she searches, but is unable to find anyone to relinquish it to;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.3.8.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc48:2.3.9.eng: The eighth training rule is finished.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing confession

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:0.5.eng: The training rule on studying worldly subjects

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo tiracchānavijjaṃ pariyāpuṇanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.2.eng: At that time the nuns from the group of six were studying worldly subjects.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma bhikkhuniyo tiracchānavijjaṃ pariyāpuṇissanti, seyyathāpi gihiniyo kāmabhoginiyo”ti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.4.eng: “How can the nuns study worldly subjects? They’re just like householders who indulge in worldly pleasures!”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.5.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhuniyo tesaṃ manussānaṃ ujjhāyantānaṃ khiyyantānaṃ vipācentānaṃ.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.5.eng: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.6.pli: Yā tā bhikkhuniyo appicchā …pe… tā ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.6.eng: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.7.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?” …

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.8.pli: “saccaṃ kira, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo tiracchānavijjaṃ pariyāpuṇantī”ti?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.8.eng: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns do this?”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.11.pli: kathañhi nāma, bhikkhave, chabbaggiyā bhikkhuniyo tiracchānavijjaṃ pariyāpuṇissanti.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.11.eng: “How can the nuns from the group of six do this?

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.13.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, bhikkhuniyo imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddisantu—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.13.eng: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:1.14.1.eng: ‘If a nun studies worldly subjects, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:2.1.4.eng: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:2.1.6.eng: whatever is external to the Buddha’s Teaching, not connected with the goal.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:2.1.8.pli: padena pariyāpuṇāti, pade pade āpatti pācittiyassa.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:2.1.8.eng: if she learns by the line, then for every line she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:2.1.9.eng: If she learns by the syllable, then for every syllable she commits an offense entailing confession.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:2.2.3.comm: Dhāraṇa normally means “remembering”, but in the present context this does not fit. Here it is probably used in the sense of dhāraṇī, a verse, charm, or prayer used for protection, see SED. In this sense it is a near synonym for paritta.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:2.2.4.eng: if she learns verses for the purpose of protection;

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:2.2.6.eng: if she is the first offender.

pli-tv-bi-vb-pc49:2.2.7.eng: The ninth training rule is finished.
